entry.content:
CodeWars 6kyu. Dubstep

ë¥ìŠ¤í… ì œëª©ì„ Decoding í•˜ê¸°

Polycarpus works as a DJ in the best Berland nightclub, and he often uses dubstep music in his performance. Recently, he has decided to take a couple of old songs and make dubstep remixes from them.

Letâ€™s assume that a song consists of some number of words (that donâ€™t contain WUB). To make the dubstep remix of this song, Polycarpus inserts a certain number of words â€œWUBâ€ before the first word of the song (the number may be zero), after the last word (the number may be zero), and between words (at least one between any pair of neighbouring words), and then the boy glues together all the words, including â€œWUBâ€, in one string and plays the song at the club.

For example, a song with words â€œI AM Xâ€ can transform into a dubstep remix as â€œWUBWUBIWUBAMWUBWUBXâ€ and cannot transform into â€œWUBWUBIAMWUBXâ€.

Recently, Jonny has heard Polycarpusâ€™s new dubstep track, but since he isnâ€™t into modern music, he decided to find out what was the initial song that Polycarpus remixed. Help Jonny restore the original song.

Input

The input consists of a single non-empty string, consisting only of uppercase English letters, the stringâ€™s length doesnâ€™t exceed 200 characters

Output

Return the words of the initial song that Polycarpus used to make a dubsteb remix. Separate the words with a space.

entry.title: LeetCode 27. Remove Element
entry.content:
LeetCode 27. Remove Element

Input ë°°ì—´ì˜ ìš”ì†Œë¥¼ ì œê±°í•˜ê¸° : in-place Algorithm

Given an array nums and a value val, remove all instances of that value in-place and return the new length.

Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory.

The order of elements can be changed. It doesnâ€™t matter what you leave beyond the new length.

Example 1:

Given nums = [3,2,2,3], val = 3,

Your function should return length = 2, with the first two elements of nums being 2.

It doesnâ€™t matter what you leave beyond the returned length.

Example 2:

Given nums = [0,1,2,2,3,0,4,2], val = 2,

Your function should return length = 5, with the first five elements of nums containing 0, 1, 3, 0, and 4.

Note that the order of those five elements can be arbitrary.

It doesnâ€™t matter what values are set beyond the returned length.

    ìŠ¤í„°ë””ì›ë“¤ê³¼ ëŒ€í™”ë¥¼ í•˜ë©° numsë¥¼ ì§ì ‘ ì ‘ê·¼í•˜ê³  ë³€í˜•í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ë¯€ë¡œ ê·¸ëŸ´ í•„ìš”ê°€ ì—†ë‹¤ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ì•Œì•˜ë‹¤.

Given a sorted array nums, remove the duplicates in-place such that each element appear only once and return the new length.

Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory.

Example 1:
Given nums = [1,1,2],

Your function should return length = 2, with the first two elements of nums being 1 and 2 respectively.

It doesnâ€™t matter what you leave beyond the returned length.

Example 2:
Given nums = [0,0,1,1,1,2,2,3,3,4],

Your function should return length = 5, with the first five elements of nums being modified to 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively.

It doesnâ€™t matter what values are set beyond the returned length.
